action.action-desc: Mr. Issa (for himself, Mr. Joyce of Ohio, Ms. Lofgren, Ms. Lee of Florida, Ms. Jackson Lee, and Ms. Perez) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 35, United States Code, to provide for an exception from infringement for certain component parts of motor vehicles.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Save Money on Auto Repair Transportation Act or the SMART Act.

section.header: Exception from infringement for certain component parts of motor vehicles
section.text: Section 271 of title 35, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: means a component part of the exterior of a motor vehicle only, such as a hood, fender, tail light, side mirror, or quarter panel; and
does not include an inflatable restraint system or other component part located in the interior of a motor vehicle;

subparagraph.text: the term make includes any testing of an article of manufacture;
the term motor vehicle has the meaning given the term in section 32101(7) of title 49; and
the term offer to sell includes any marketing of an article of manufacture to prospective purchasers or users and any pre-sale distribution of the article of manufacture.

paragraph.text: With respect to a design patent that claims a component part of a motor vehicle as originally manufactured—

subparagraph.text: it shall not be an act of infringement of the design patent to make or offer to sell within the United States, or import into the United States, any article of manufacture that is similar or the same in appearance to the component part that is claimed in the design patent if the purpose of the article of manufacture is for the repair of a motor vehicle so as to restore the motor vehicle to the appearance of the motor vehicle as originally manufactured; and

after the expiration of a period of 30 months beginning on the first day on which any such component part is first offered to the public for sale as part of a motor vehicle in any country, it shall not be an act of infringement of the design patent to use or sell within the United States any article of manufacture that is similar or the same in appearance to the component part that is claimed in the design patent if the purpose of the article of manufacture is for the repair of a motor vehicle so as to restore the motor vehicle to the appearance of the motor vehicle as originally manufactured.

section.text: Section 289 of title 35, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in the first undesignated paragraph, by striking Whoever and inserting the following:
in the second undesignated paragraph, by striking Nothing and inserting the following:
by inserting after subsection (a), as so designated, the following:

subsection.text: This section shall not apply to an act described in paragraph (1) or (2) of subsection (a) if that act would not be considered an act of infringement under section 271(j)

section.text: The amendments made by this Act shall take effect upon the expiration of the 90-day period beginning on the date of the enactment of this Act and shall apply to any patent issued, or application for patent filed, before, on, or after that effective date.
